dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S1331 IS: To extend the Generalized System of Preferences, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Baucus (for himself and Mr. Hatch) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To extend the Generalized System of Preferences, and for other purposes.

section.header: Extension of Generalized System of Preferences
section.text: Section 505 of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2465) is amended by striking July 31, 2013 and inserting September 30, 2015.
Section 13031(j)(3) of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (19 U.S.C. 58c(j)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking October 22, 2021 and inserting January 21, 2022; and
in subparagraph (B)(i), by striking October 29, 2021 and inserting January 28, 2022.

section.header: Time for payment of corporate estimated taxes
section.text: Notwithstanding section 6655 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, in the case of a corporation with assets of not less than $1,000,000,000 (determined as of the end of the preceding taxable year)—

paragraph.text: the amount of any required installment of corporate estimated tax which is otherwise due in July, August, or September of 2018 shall be increased by 1.25 percent of such amount (determined without regard to any increase in such amount not contained in such Code); and
the amount of the next required installment after an installment referred to in paragraph (1) shall be appropriately reduced to reflect the amount of the increase by reason of such paragraph.
